description: Square array read by anti-diagonals: number of ways a pawn-like piece (with the initial 2-step move forbidden and starting from any square on the back rank) can end at various squares on an infinite chessboard.
comments: Table formatted as a square array shows the top-left corner of the infinite board.
links: Hans L. Bodlaender, The Chess Variant Pages
Hans L. Bodlaender et al., editors, The Piececlopedia (An overview of several fairy chess pieces)
